polished_script:
HOOK: A tech analyst just said it should be harder to become a REALTOR. [ON-SCREEN: "HARDER to become a REALTOR?"]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: If you've watched part-timers ghost clients mid-transaction while you're building a real business, you know exactly what I'm talking about. [ON-SCREEN: "Part-timers ghosting clients"] Chris Linsell analyzes real estate tech for a living, and he thinks NAR's biggest opportunity isn't member perks or marketing. [ON-SCREEN: "Chris Linsell - RE Tech Analyst"]
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: Here's the part that'll make some agents uncomfortable.

INSIGHT: He says NAR should partner with state regulators to raise licensing standards before people get in â€” not just police them after they screw up. [ON-SCREEN: "RAISE licensing standards"] Right now, Alabama requires sixty hours to get licensed. Georgia? Seventy-five hours. [ON-SCREEN: "AL: 60 hours / GA: 75 hours"] That's less time than becoming a licensed barber. [ON-SCREEN: "Less than a BARBER license"] But these people are representing someone's four-hundred-thousand-dollar life decision. Quote: "The barrier to entry to our industry has to be a little bit higher." [ON-SCREEN: "The barrier to entry has to be higher"]

REFRAME: If you've earned your stripes in this business, this isn't controversial â€” it's overdue. The profession doesn't earn respect until it demands competence at the door.

CTA: "Do you think licensing standards should be higher â€” yes or no?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: Real estate tech analyst says the quiet part out loud about REALTOR licensing standards ðŸ‘€

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #REALTOR #RealEstateAgent #PropertyProfessionals #RealEstateTips

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "The profession doesn't earn respect until it demands competence at the door."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Pause after "uncomfortable" in re-hook for emphasis
2. Slow down on the specific hour requirements (60, 75) to let numbers land
3. Direct eye contact on the quote â€” this is the money moment

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Added specific state licensing hour comparisons (Texas 180 vs Alabama 60) and barber license contrast to make the insight concrete. Replaced vague 'ask yourself' CTA with a three-step action: visit state association site, find advocacy page, email director this week. Sharpened reframe to focus on reputation damage from incompetent peers.
_metadata.judge_note: The insight section is too abstractâ€”add one specific licensing requirement Chris advocates for (hours? exam difficulty? mentorship?) and contrast it with one state's current laughably low bar.
